text:
hello!

I have a client who utilizes HubSpot forms, and I do not have access to their HubSpot account. They are inquiring about why their google recaptcha is not filtering spam.

I found an article about enabling the recaptcha on the formbuilder; is it truly as simple as toggling a button? or will the client need to create an API key through recaptcha and provide that key somewhere in the HubSpot backend/account info?
Yep HubSpot pays for the recaptcha so you really only need to flip the switch

how is this recaptcha injected? in an iframe?

I found an empty iframe in the client’s form code, and just above that iframe is an <input> field that is hidden, and the value contains an object, and in the object it has a key/value pair “captchaStatus”:“NOT_APPLICABLE”
thanks for the prompt reply, Carter!
Yes of course, so yes recaptchas are rendered in iframes
if you are a contact in HubSpot you won't see the recaptcha but if you aren't and are possibly a bot HubSpot will show it
cool, I can’t even locate the iframe anywhere on their forms, they have informed me they have it enabled and can see it in their formbuilder, but I am new to HubSpot + I can’t use their account!
so maybe, they don’t have it enabled?
if you have submitted information on that website before, HubSpot will have stored a cookie saying you're a contact, so that iframe won't necessarily show up
okay ill open in an incognito, I did submit the form once but multiple weeks ago, for testing purposes.
still not seeing anything about reCAPTCHA besides in this object:
